snippet: New legislation on claims for property lost during and after World War II was seen as a small acknowledgment of the treatment of Jews.
abstract: Romanian government approves legislation giving priority to restitution claims by Holocaust survivors for property lost during World War II and under Communist rule; move represents small acknowledgment of mistreatment suffered by Romanian Jews during  war.
lead_paragraph: New legislation on claims for property lost during and after World War II was seen as a small acknowledgment of the treatment of Jews.

headline.main: Romania Takes Step Toward Restitution to Holocaust Survivors
headline.print_headline: Romania Takes Step for Holocaust Survivor Restitution
